definition: to provide critical care (to a patient or a diseased plant)
to rule/to govern/to manage/to control/to harness (a river)/to treat (a disease)/to wipe out (a pest)/to punish/to research

sentences.english: Immediately, Sumou was sent to Nanning Red Cross Hospital for treatment.
sentences.chinese: 隨即，蘇某被送到南寧市紅十字會醫院進行救治。

sentences.english: Conclusion The comprehensive treatment most patients with acute chlorphenamidine poisoning can be cured.
sentences.chinese: 結論經綜合救治，多能使急性殺蟲脒中毒患者得救。

sentences.english: Objective Present paper aims at Summing up the experience of mass hot cement burn Casulties.
sentences.chinese: 目的總結成批熱水泥燒傷病人救治經驗。

sentences.english: Objective To explore the treatment of the open trauma of the auricle of pinna.
sentences.chinese: 目的總結頸部開放性外傷臨牀救治經驗。

sentences.english: To investigate the treatment method and effect for neck injury.

sentences.english: Conclusion Trinity is cure and nursing paraquat intoxication of patients with effective method.

sentences.english: Conclusion Hemoperfusion is an effective therapy for early drug poisoning.

sentences.english: An approach of adapting rocky desertification convulsion ethnic culture should be taken into account.

sentences.english: Objective To improve the success rate for emergency treatment of patients with acute severe drug poisoning.
sentences.chinese: 目的提高急重症藥物中毒患者的救治成功率。

sentences.english: Afterward, the strong health arrives at in-patient department, sees in hospital treatment baby and guardian.

sentences.english: ObjectiveTo evaluate axillofemoral bypass(AxFB) for the treatment of chronic severe lower limb ischemia.

sentences.english: Objective To summarize clinical experience of treating penetrating cardiac injuries patients in emergency room thoracotomy (ERT).

sentences.english: Objective To discuss the treatment of acute gravis craniocerebral injury.
sentences.chinese: 目的探討急性特重型顱腦傷的救治方法。

sentences.english: I radioed in a helicopter; both Keith and Pete needed immediate medical attention.

definition: to transfer (a patient) to a different hospital/to transfer to hospital (e.g. a prisoner)
to send or deliver to the hospital
to receive hospital treatment/to be hospitalized
